sentence.text: Ow!
sentence.textCn: 啊哟!

sentence.text: What's the matter, Andy?
sentence.textCn: 怎么了，安迪？

sentence.text: I slipped and fell downstairs.
sentence.textCn: 我滑了一跤，从楼梯上摔下来了。

sentence.text: Have you hurt yourself?
sentence.textCn: 你摔伤了没有？

sentence.text: Yes, I have.
sentence.textCn: 是啊，摔伤了。

sentence.text: I think that I've hurt my back.
sentence.textCn: 我想我把背摔坏了。

sentence.text: Try and stand up.
sentence.textCn: 试试站起来。

sentence.text: Can you stand up?
sentence.textCn: 你能站起来吗？

sentence.text: Here. Let me help you.
sentence.textCn: 来，让我帮你。

sentence.text: I'm sorry, Lucy.
sentence.textCn: 对不起，露西。

sentence.text: I'm afraid that I can't get up.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕我站不起来。

sentence.text: I think that the doctor had better see you.
sentence.textCn: 我想最好请医生来看一下。

sentence.text: I'll phone Dr. Carter.
sentence.textCn: 我去给卡特医生打电话。

sentence.text: The doctor says that he will come at once.
sentence.textCn: 医生说他马上就来。

sentence.text: I'm sure that you need an X-ray, Andy.
sentence.textCn: 安迪，我看你需要做一次 X 光透视。

sentence.text: Read Jimmy's card to me please, Penny.
sentence.textCn: 请把吉米的明信片念给我听听，彭妮。

sentence.text: 'I have just arrived in Scotland and I'm staying at a Youth Hostel.'
sentence.textCn: “我刚到苏格兰，我现在住一家青年招待所。”

sentence.text: Eh?
sentence.textCn: 什么？

sentence.text: He says he's just arrived in Scotland.
sentence.textCn: 他说他刚到苏格兰。

sentence.text: He says he's staying at a Youth Hostel.
sentence.textCn: 他说他现在住一家青年招待所。

sentence.text: You know he's a member of the Y.H.A.
sentence.textCn: 您知道，他是“青招协”的一个成员。

sentence.text: The what?
sentence.textCn: 什么？

sentence.text: The Y.H.A., Mum.
sentence.textCn: “青招协”，妈妈。

sentence.text: The Youth Hostels Association.
sentence.textCn: 青年招待所协会。

sentence.text: What else does he say?
sentence.textCn: 他还说了些什么？

sentence.text: 'I'll write a letter soon. I hope you are all well.'
sentence.textCn: “我很快会写信的。祝你们大家身体都好。”

sentence.text: What?
sentence.textCn: 什么？

sentence.text: Speak up, Penny.
sentence.textCn: 彭妮，大声一点。

sentence.text: I'm afraid I can't hear you.
sentence.textCn: 我可听不见你念的。

sentence.text: He says he'll write a letter soon.
sentence.textCn: 他说他很快会写信的。

sentence.text: He hopes we are all well.
sentence.textCn: 他祝我们大家身体好。

sentence.text: 'Love, Jimmy.'
sentence.textCn: “谨此问候，吉米。”

sentence.text: Is that all?
sentence.textCn: 就这些吗？

sentence.text: He doesn't say very much, does he?
sentence.textCn: 他没写许多，是吗？

sentence.text: He can't write very much on a card, Mum.
sentence.textCn: 在明信片上他写不了很多，妈妈。

sentence.text: How was the exam, Richard?
sentence.textCn: 考试考得怎样，理查德？

sentence.text: Not too bad.
sentence.textCn: 不算太坏。

sentence.text: I think I passed in English and Mathematics.
sentence.textCn: 我想我的英语和数学及格了。

sentence.text: The questions were very easy.
sentence.textCn: 题目很容易。

sentence.text: How about you, Gary?
sentence.textCn: 加里，你怎么样？

sentence.text: The English and Maths papers weren't easy enough for me.
sentence.textCn: 英语和数学试题对我来说很不容易。

sentence.text: I hope I haven't failed.
sentence.textCn: 我希望别不及格。

sentence.text: I think I failed the French paper.
sentence.textCn: 我想我的法语及不了格。

sentence.text: I could answer sixteen of the questions.
sentence.textCn: 我能回答其中的16道题。

sentence.text: They were very easy.
sentence.textCn: 这些题很容易。

sentence.text: But I couldn't answer the rest.
sentence.textCn: 但我回答不出其余的题。

sentence.text: They were too difficult for me.
sentence.textCn: 那些题对我来说太难了。

sentence.text: French tests are awful, aren't they?
sentence.textCn: 法语太可怕了，你说呢？

sentence.text: I hate them.
sentence.textCn: 我讨厌法语。

sentence.text: I'm sure I've got a low mark.
sentence.textCn: 我的法语成绩肯定很低。

sentence.text: Oh, cheer up!
sentence.textCn: 啊，别灰心！

sentence.text: Perhaps we didn't do too badly.
sentence.textCn: 或许我们考得还不太糟。

sentence.text: The guy next to me wrote his name at the top of the paper.
sentence.textCn: 坐在我旁边的那个人只在试卷顶端写了自己的名字。

sentence.text: Yes?
sentence.textCn: 是吗？

sentence.text: Then he sat there and looked at it for three hours!
sentence.textCn: 然后他就坐在那里，对着考卷看了3个小时！

sentence.text: He didn't write a word!
sentence.textCn: 一个字也没写！

sentence.text: Where's Sandra, Bob?
sentence.textCn: 鲍勃，桑德拉在哪儿？

sentence.text: I want her.
sentence.textCn: 我要找她。

sentence.text: Do you want to speak to her?
sentence.textCn: 您要同她谈话吗？

sentence.text: Yes, I do. I want her to come to my office. Tell her to come at once.
sentence.textCn: 是的，我要她到我的办公室来。叫她马上就来。

sentence.text: Did you want to see me?
sentence.textCn: 您找我吗？

sentence.text: Ah, yes, Sandra. How do you spell 'intelligent'? Can you tell me?
sentence.textCn: 啊，是的，桑德拉。“intelligent”怎样拼写？你能告诉我吗？

sentence.text: I-N-T-E-L-L-I-G-E-N-T.
sentence.textCn: I—N—T—E—L—L—I—G—E—N—T。

sentence.text: That's right. You've typed it with only one 'L'. This letter's full of mistakes. I want you to type it again.
sentence.textCn: 对的。但你只打了1个“L”。这封信里错误百出。我要你重打一遍。

sentence.text: Yes, I'll do that. I'm sorry about that.
sentence.textCn: 是，我重打。对此我感到很抱歉。

sentence.text: And here's a little present for you.
sentence.textCn: 这里有一件小礼物送你。

sentence.text: What is it?
sentence.textCn: 是什么？

sentence.text: It's a dictionary. I hope it'll help you.
sentence.textCn: 是本词典。我希望它能对你有所帮助。

word.textCn: 夫人, 女士（对妇女的尊称）

sentence.text: Do you like this dress, madam?
sentence.textCn: 夫人，您喜欢这件衣服吗？

sentence.text: I like the colour very much. It's a lovely dress, but it's too small for me.
sentence.textCn: 我很喜欢这颜色。这是件漂亮的衣服，可是对我来说太小了。

sentence.text: What about this one? It's a lovely dress. It's very smart. Short skirts are in fashion now. Would you like to try it?
sentence.textCn: 这件怎么样？这是件漂亮的衣服，它很时髦。短裙现在很流行。您要试一试吗？

sentence.text: All right.
sentence.textCn: 好吧。

sentence.text: I'm afraid this green dress is too small for me as well. It's smaller than the blue one.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕这件绿色的我穿着也太小了。它比那件蓝色的还要小。

sentence.text: I don't like the colour either. It doesn't suit me at all. I think the blue dress is prettier.
sentence.textCn: 我也不喜欢这种颜色。这颜色我穿根本不合适。我认为那件蓝色的更漂亮些。

sentence.text: Could you show me another blue dress? I want a dress like that one, but it must be my size.
sentence.textCn: 您能再给我看一件蓝色的吗？我想要一件和那件一样的，但必须是我的尺寸。

sentence.text: I'm afraid I haven't got a larger dress. This is the largest dress in the shop.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕没有更大的了。这是店里最大的一件。

word.textCn: 少许 (用于不可数名词之前)
(little的比较级) 较少的, 更小的
几个 (用于可数名词之前)
(little的最高级) 最小的, 最少的

sentence.text: Shall I make some coffee, Jane?
sentence.textCn: 我来煮点咖啡好吗，简？

sentence.text: That's a good idea, Charlotte.
sentence.textCn: 这是个好主意，夏洛特。

sentence.text: It's ready. Do you want any milk?
sentence.textCn: 咖啡好了，你要放点奶吗？

sentence.text: Just a little, please.
sentence.textCn: 请稍加一点。

sentence.text: What about some sugar? Two teaspoonfuls?
sentence.textCn: 加些糖怎么样？两茶匙行吗？

sentence.text: No, less than that. One and a half teaspoonfuls, please. That's enough for me.
sentence.textCn: 不，再少一些。请放一勺半儿。那对我已足够了。

sentence.text: That was very nice.
sentence.textCn: 太好了。

sentence.text: Would you like some more?
sentence.textCn: 你再来点吗？

sentence.text: Yes, please.
sentence.textCn: 好的，请再来一点。

sentence.text: I'd like a cigarette, too. May I have one?
sentence.textCn: 我还想抽枝烟。可以给我一枝吗？

sentence.text: Of course. I think there are a few in that box.
sentence.textCn: 当然可以。我想那个盒子里有一些。

sentence.text: I'm afraid it's empty.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕盒子是空的。

sentence.text: What a pity!
sentence.textCn: 真遗憾！

sentence.text: It doesn't matter.
sentence.textCn: 没关系。

sentence.text: Have a biscuit instead. Eat more and smoke less!
sentence.textCn: 那就吃块饼干吧。多吃点，少抽点！

sentence.text: That's very good advice!
sentence.textCn: 这是极好的忠告啊！

sentence.text: I like this television very much. How much does it cost?
sentence.textCn: 我非常喜欢这台电视机。请问它多少钱？

sentence.text: It's the most expensive model in the shop. It costs five hundred pounds.
sentence.textCn: 这是店里最贵的型号。它的售价是500英镑。

sentence.text: That's too expensive for us. We can't afford all that money.
sentence.textCn: 这对我们来说是太贵了。我们花不起那么多钱。

sentence.text: This model's less expensive than that one. It's only three hundred pounds. But, of course, it's not as good as the expensive one.
sentence.textCn: 这种型号的比那种要便宜些。它只要300英镑。但是，它当然没有价钱高的那种好。

sentence.text: I don't like this model. The other model's more expensive, but it's worth the money.
sentence.textCn: 我不喜欢这种型号。那一种型号价格是贵一些，但它值这么多钱。

sentence.text: Can we buy it on instalments?
sentence.textCn: 我们可以用分期付款的方式购买吗？

sentence.text: Of course. You can pay a deposit of thirty pounds, and then fourteen pounds a month for three years.
sentence.textCn: 当然可以。您可以先付30英镑定金，然后每月14镑，3年付清。

sentence.text: Do you like it, dear?
sentence.textCn: 你喜欢吗，亲爱的？

sentence.text: I certainly do, but I don't like the price. You always want the best, but we can't afford it. Sometimes you think you're a millionaire!
sentence.textCn: 我当然喜欢，但是我喜欢这个价钱。你总是要买最好的，可我们买不起。有时候你认为自己是个百万富翁！

sentence.text: Millionaires don't buy things on instalments!
sentence.textCn: 百万富翁是不会分期付款买东西的！

sentence.text: Fares, please!
sentence.textCn: 请买票！

sentence.text: Trafalgar Square, please.
sentence.textCn: 请买一张到特拉法加广场的票。

sentence.text: I'm sorry, sir. I can't change a ten-pound note. Haven't you got any small change?
sentence.textCn: 对不起，我找不开10英镑的钞票。您没有零钱吗？

sentence.text: I've got no small change, I'm afraid.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕我没有零钱。

sentence.text: I'll ask some of the passengers.
sentence.textCn: 我来问问其他乘客。

sentence.text: Have you any small change, sir?
sentence.textCn: 先生，您有零钱吗？

sentence.text: I'm sorry. I've got none.
sentence.textCn: 对不起，我没有。

sentence.text: I haven't got any either.
sentence.textCn: 我也没有。

sentence.text: Can you change this ten-pound note, madam?
sentence.textCn: 夫人，您能把这10英镑的钞票换开吗？

sentence.text: I'm afraid I can't.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕不能。

sentence.text: Neither can I.
sentence.textCn: 我也不能。

sentence.text: I'm very sorry, sir. You must get off the bus. None of our passengers can change this note. They're all millionaires!
sentence.textCn: 非常抱歉，先生。您必须下车。我们的乘客中没人能换开这张钞票。他们都是百万富翁！

sentence.text: Except us.
sentence.textCn: 我们俩除外。

sentence.text: I've got some small change.
sentence.textCn: 我有零钱。

sentence.text: So have I.
sentence.textCn: 我也有。

sentence.text: Isn't there anyone at home?
sentence.textCn: 家里没有人吗？

sentence.text: I'll knock again, Helen. Everything's very quiet. I'm sure there's no one at home.
sentence.textCn: 海伦，我再敲一次。毫无动静，肯定家里没有人。

sentence.text: But that's impossible. Carol and Tom invited us to lunch. Look through the window.
sentence.textCn: 但这足不可能的。卡罗尔和汤姆请我们来吃午饭。从窗子往里看看。

sentence.text: Can you see anything?
sentence.textCn: 你能看见什么吗？

sentence.text: Nothing at all.
sentence.textCn: 什么也看不见。

sentence.text: Let's try the back door.
sentence.textCn: 让我们到后门去试试。

sentence.text: Look! Everyone's in the garden.
sentence.textCn: 瞧！大家都在花园里。

sentence.text: Hello, Helen. Hello, Jim.
sentence.textCn: 你好，海伦。你好，吉姆。

sentence.text: Everybody wants to have lunch in the garden. It's nice and warm out here.
sentence.textCn: 大家都想在花园里吃午饭。这外面挺暖和。

sentence.text: Come and have something to drink.
sentence.textCn: 来喝点什么。

sentence.text: Thanks, Carol. May I have a glass of beer please?
sentence.textCn: 谢谢，卡罗尔。给我一杯啤酒好吗？

sentence.text: Beer? There's none left. You can have some lemonade.
sentence.textCn: 啤酒？一点都不剩了。你可以喝点柠檬水。

sentence.text: Lemonade!
sentence.textCn: 柠檬水!

sentence.text: Don't believe her, Jim. She's only joking. Have some beer!
sentence.textCn: 吉姆，别信她的。她只是在开玩笑。喝点啤酒吧！

sentence.text: When my husband was going into the dining room this morning, he dropped some coins on the floor.
sentence.textCn: 今天早晨我丈夫走进饭厅时，把一些硬币掉在地上了。

sentence.text: There were coins everywhere. We looked for them, but we could not find them all.
sentence.textCn: 到处都是硬币。我们虽然找了，但没能把它们全部找到。

sentence.text: While we were having breakfast, our little boy, Tommy, found two small coins on the floor.
sentence.textCn: 正当我们吃早饭时，我们的小男孩汤米在地上找到了两枚小硬币。

sentence.text: He put them both into his mouth. We both tried to get the coins, but it was too late. Tommy had already swallowed them!
sentence.textCn: 他把这两枚硬币全都放进了嘴里。我们俩都试图把这两枚硬币拿出来，但太迟了。汤米已经把硬币咽了下去！

sentence.text: Later that morning, when I was doing the housework, my husband phoned me from the office.
sentence.textCn: 那天上午的晚些时候，当我正做家务时，我丈夫从办公室打来电话。

sentence.text: 'How's Tommy?' he asked.
sentence.textCn: “汤米怎么样？”他问。

sentence.text: 'I don't know,' I answered. 'Tommy's been to the toilet three times this morning, but I haven't had any change yet!'
sentence.textCn: “我不知道，”我回答说，“今天上午汤米去了3次厕所了，但我还没看到硬币！”

sentence.text: Do you like stories? I want to tell you a true story. It happened to a friend of mine a year ago.
sentence.textCn: 你喜欢听故事吗？我要告诉你一个真实的故事。这是一年前发生在我的一位朋友身上的故事。

sentence.text: While my friend, George, was reading in bed, two thieves climbed into his kitchen.
sentence.textCn: 当我的朋友乔治在床上看书时，两个小偷爬进了他的厨房。

sentence.text: After they had entered the house, they went into the dining room. It was very dark, so they turned on a torch.
sentence.textCn: 他们进到屋里后，走进了饭厅。饭厅里很暗，于是他们打开了手电筒。

sentence.text: Suddenly, they heard a voice behind them. 'What's up? What's up?' someone called. The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could.
sentence.textCn: 突然他们听到身后有声音。“什么事？什么事？”有人叫着。小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。

sentence.text: George heard the noise and came downstairs quickly.
sentence.textCn: 乔治听到了响声，迅速地下了楼。

sentence.text: He turned on the light, but he couldn't see anyone. The thieves had already gone.
sentence.textCn: 他开了灯，但不见一个人。小偷逃走了。

sentence.text: But George's parrot, Henry, was still there. 'What's up, George?' he called. 'Nothing, Henry,' George said and smiled. 'Go back to sleep.'
sentence.textCn: 但是乔治的鹦鹉亨利仍在那里。“什么事，乔治？”它叫着。“没事，亨利。”乔治笑着说，“接着睡觉吧。”

word.textCn: 照应, 服务, 接待

sentence.text: I bought two expensive dictionaries here half an hour ago, but I forgot to take them with me.
sentence.textCn: 半小时以前我在这里买了两本很贵的辞典，但是我忘了拿走。

sentence.text: Who served you, sir?
sentence.textCn: 是谁接待您的，先生？

sentence.text: The lady who is standing behind the counter.
sentence.textCn: 站在柜台后面的那位女士。

sentence.text: Which books did you buy?
sentence.textCn: 您买的是两本什么书？

sentence.text: The books which are on the counter.
sentence.textCn: 就是柜台上的那两本。

sentence.text: Did you serve this gentleman half an hour ago, Caroline? He says he's the man who bought these books.
sentence.textCn: 卡罗琳，半小时前你接待过这位先生吗？他说他就是买这两本书的人。

sentence.text: I can't remember. The man who I served was wearing a hat.
sentence.textCn: 我记不起来了。我接待的那个人戴着一顶帽子。

sentence.text: Have you got a hat, sir?
sentence.textCn: 先生，您有帽子吗？

sentence.text: Yes, I have.
sentence.textCn: 有的，我有帽子。

sentence.text: Would you put it on, please?
sentence.textCn: 请您把帽子戴上好吗？

sentence.text: All right.
sentence.textCn: 好吧。

sentence.text: Is this the man that you served, Caroline?
sentence.textCn: 卡罗琳，这就是你接待过的那个人吗？

sentence.text: Yes. I recognize him now.
sentence.textCn: 是他。我现在认出他来了。

word.textCn: （下巴上的）胡子, 络腮胡子

sentence.text: Look, Scott. This is a photograph I took during my trip to Australia.
sentence.textCn: 看，这是我到澳大利亚旅行时拍的一张照片。

sentence.text: Let me see it, Mike.
sentence.textCn: 让我看看，迈克。

sentence.text: This is a good photograph. Who are these people?
sentence.textCn: 这是一张很好的照片。这些人是谁？

sentence.text: They're people I met during the trip.
sentence.textCn: 他们是我旅行时认识的人。

sentence.text: That's the ship we travelled on.
sentence.textCn: 这是我们所乘的那条船。

sentence.text: What a beautiful ship!
sentence.textCn: 多漂亮的船啊！

sentence.text: Who's this?
sentence.textCn: 这是谁？

sentence.text: That's the man I told you about. Remember?
sentence.textCn: 这就是我跟你说过的的那个人。还记得吗？

sentence.text: Ah yes. The one who offered you a job in Australia.
sentence.textCn: 啊，记得。就是在澳大利亚给你工作做的那个人。

sentence.text: That's right.
sentence.textCn: 对。

sentence.text: Who's this?
sentence.textCn: 这是谁？

sentence.text: Guess!
sentence.textCn: 你猜！

sentence.text: It's not you, is it?
sentence.textCn: 这不是你，对吗？

sentence.text: That's right.
sentence.textCn: 不，是我。

sentence.text: I grew a beard during the trip, but I shaved it off when I came home.
sentence.textCn: 我在旅行时留了胡子，但我回到家时就把它刮了。

sentence.text: Why did you shave it off?
sentence.textCn: 你为什么把它刮了？

sentence.text: My wife didn't like it!
sentence.textCn: 我妻子不喜欢！

sentence.text: Can't you come in and have tea now, Peter?
sentence.textCn: 彼得，你现在能进来喝茶吗？

sentence.text: Not yet. I must water the garden first.
sentence.textCn: 还不能。我得先给花园浇水。

sentence.text: Do you have to water it now?
sentence.textCn: 你一定得现在浇吗？

sentence.text: I'm afraid I must. Look at it! It's terribly dry.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕我得现在浇。你看看，干得厉害。

sentence.text: What a nuisance!
sentence.textCn: 真讨厌！

sentence.text: Last summer it was very dry, too. Don't you remember? I had to water it every day.
sentence.textCn: 去年夏天也是干得很。你不记得了吗？我不得不每天浇水。

sentence.text: Well, I'll have tea by myself.
sentence.textCn: 好吧，我一个人喝茶了。

sentence.text: That was quick! Have you finished already?
sentence.textCn: 好快啊！你已经浇完了？

sentence.text: Yes. Look out of the window.
sentence.textCn: 是的。你看看窗外。

sentence.text: It's raining! That means you don't need to water the garden.
sentence.textCn: 下雨了！这就是说，你不必给花园浇水了。

sentence.text: That was a pleasant surprise. It means I can have tea, instead.
sentence.textCn: 这是意想不到的好事。这意味着我反倒可以喝茶了。

sentence.text: Can you recognize that woman, Liz?
sentence.textCn: 莉兹，你能认出那个女人吗？

sentence.text: I think I can, Kate. It must be Karen Marsh, the actress.
sentence.textCn: 我想我认得出来，凯特。那一定是女演员卡伦·马什。

sentence.text: I thought so. Who's that beside her?
sentence.textCn: 我也这样想。她旁边的那个人是谁？

sentence.text: That must be Conrad Reeves.
sentence.textCn: 一定是康拉德·里弗斯。

sentence.text: Conrad Reeves, the actor? It can't be. Let me have another look. I think you're right! Isn't he her third husband?
sentence.textCn: 康拉德·里弗斯，那个男演员吗？不可能是。让我再看一看。我想你是对的。他不是她的第3个丈夫吗？

sentence.text: No. He must be her fourth or fifth.
sentence.textCn: 不，他一定是她的第4个或第5个丈夫。

sentence.text: Doesn't Karen Marsh look old!
sentence.textCn: 卡伦看上去不显老嘛！

sentence.text: She does, doesn't she! I read she's twenty-nine, but she must be at least forty.
sentence.textCn: 是的，谁说不是呢！我从报上看到她是29岁，但她一定至少有40岁了。

sentence.text: I'm sure she is.
sentence.textCn: 我肯定她有40岁了。

sentence.text: She was a famous actress when I was still at school.
sentence.textCn: 当我还是学生时，她就是个著名的演员了。

sentence.text: That was a long time ago, wasn't it?
sentence.textCn: 那是好久以前的事了，是吗？

sentence.text: Not that long ago! I'm not more than twenty-nine myself.
sentence.textCn: 不，没有那么久。我自己现在还没过29岁呢。

sentence.text: Look, Gary! That policeman's waving to you. He wants you to stop.
sentence.textCn: 瞧，加里！那个警察正朝你挥手呢。他要你停下来。

sentence.text: Where do you think you are? On a race track? You must have been driving at seventy miles an hour.
sentence.textCn: 你认为你现在是在哪儿？在赛车道上吗？你刚才一定是以每小时70英里的速度开车。

sentence.text: I can't have been.
sentence.textCn: 我不会开得那样快的。

sentence.text: I was doing eighty when I overtook you.
sentence.textCn: 我是以每小时80英里的速度赶上你的。

sentence.text: Didn't you see the speed limit?
sentence.textCn: 难道你没看见限速牌吗？

sentence.text: I'm afraid I didn't, officer. I must have been dreaming.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕我没有看见，警官。我一定是思想开小差了。

sentence.text: He wasn't dreaming, officer. I was telling him to drive slowly.
sentence.textCn: 警官，他思想没有开小差。我刚才正告诉他开慢点。

sentence.text: That's why I didn't see the sign.
sentence.textCn: 所以我才没看见那牌子。

sentence.text: Let me see your driving licence.
sentence.textCn: 让我看一看你的驾驶执照。

sentence.text: I won't charge you this time. But you'd better not do it again!
sentence.textCn: 这次我就不罚你款了。但你最好不要再开得这样快。

sentence.text: Thank you. I'll certainly be more careful.
sentence.textCn: 谢谢您。我以后一定会多加注意。

sentence.text: I told you to drive slowly, Gary.
sentence.textCn: 加里，我刚才叫你开慢点吧。

sentence.text: You always tell me to drive slowly, darling.
sentence.textCn: 你总是叫我开慢点，亲爱的。

sentence.text: Well, next time you'd better take my advice!
sentence.textCn: 好啦，下次你最好还是听从我的劝告吧！

sentence.text: Where are you going to spend your holidays this year, Gary?
sentence.textCn: 加里，今年你们打算去哪里度假？

sentence.text: We may go abroad. I'm not sure. My wife wants to go to Egypt. I'd like to go there, too. We can't make up our minds.
sentence.textCn: 我们可能到国外去，但我不敢肯定。我妻子想到埃及去，我也想去那儿。我们还拿不定主意。

sentence.text: Will you travel by sea or by air?
sentence.textCn: 你们乘船去，还是乘飞机去？

sentence.text: We may travel by sea.
sentence.textCn: 我们可能乘船去。

sentence.text: It's cheaper, isn't it?
sentence.textCn: 这更便宜些，是吗？

sentence.text: It may be cheaper, but it takes a long time.
sentence.textCn: 可能是便宜些，但花的时间长。

sentence.text: I'm sure you'll enjoy yourselves.
sentence.textCn: 我肯定你们一定会玩得很痛快。

sentence.text: Don't be so sure. We might not go anywhere. My wife always worries too much. Who's going to look after the dog? Who's going to look after the house? Who's going to look after the garden? We have this problem every year. In the end, we stay at home and look after everything!
sentence.textCn: 别那么肯定。我们可能哪里也去不成。我妻子总是担心那担心的。谁来照看狗啦，谁来看管房子啦，谁来照料花园啦，我们每年都碰到这类问题。末了，我们呆在家里照看一切。

word.textCn: 爆炸性的, 耸人听闻的

sentence.text: Have you just made a new film, Miss Marsh?
sentence.textCn: 您刚拍完一部新电影吗，马什小姐？

sentence.text: Yes, I have.
sentence.textCn: 是的，我刚拍完。

sentence.text: Are you going to make another?
sentence.textCn: 您准备再拍一部吗？

sentence.text: No, I'm not. I'm going to retire. I feel very tired. I don't want to make another film for a long time.
sentence.textCn: 不，我不准备拍了。我准备退休了。我感觉累得很。我早就不想再拍片子了。

sentence.text: Let's buy a newspaper, Liz. Listen to this! 'Karen Marsh: Sensational News! By our reporter, Alan Jones. Karen Marsh arrived at London Airport today. She was wearing a blue dress and a mink coat. She told me she had just made a new film. She said she was not going to make another. She said she was going to retire. She told reporters she felt very tired and didn't want to make another film for a long time.'
sentence.textCn: 我们买份报纸吧，莉兹。你听这段：“卡伦·马什：爆炸性新闻！由本报记者艾伦·琼斯报道。卡伦·马什今天到达伦敦机场。她穿着一身蓝色的套装和一件貂皮大衣。她告诉我她刚拍完一部新片子。她说她不准备再拍电影了。她说她准备退休。她告诉记者她感到很疲劳，早就不想再拍电影了。”

sentence.text: I wonder why!
sentence.textCn: 我很想知道为什么。

sentence.text: Are you really going to retire, Miss Marsh?
sentence.textCn: 您真的准备退休吗？

sentence.text: I may.
sentence.textCn: 有可能退。

sentence.text: I can't make up my mind.
sentence.textCn: 我还没拿定主意。

sentence.text: I will have to ask my future husband.
sentence.textCn: 我得问一下我的未婚夫。

sentence.text: He won't let me make another film.
sentence.textCn: 他不会再让我拍电影了。

sentence.text: Your future husband, Miss Marsh?
sentence.textCn: 您的未婚夫，马什小姐？

sentence.text: Yes. Let me introduce him to you.
sentence.textCn: 是的，让我把他给你们介绍一下。

sentence.text: His name is Carlos.
sentence.textCn: 他叫卡洛斯。

sentence.text: We're going to get married next week.
sentence.textCn: 下星期我们就要结婚了。

sentence.text: Look, Liz!
sentence.textCn: 看啊，莉兹！

sentence.text: Here's another report about Karen Marsh.
sentence.textCn: 这又有一篇关于卡伦·马什的报道。

sentence.text: Listen: 'Karen Marsh: The latest.
sentence.textCn: 你听，“卡伦·马什：最新消息。

sentence.text: At her London Hotel today Miss Marsh told reporters she might retire.
sentence.textCn: 今天在伦敦旅馆，马什小姐告诉记者她可能要退休。

sentence.text: She said she couldn't make up her mind.
sentence.textCn: 她说她还拿不定主意。

sentence.text: She said she would have to ask her future husband.
sentence.textCn: 她说她得问问她的未婚夫。

sentence.text: She said her future husband would not let her make another film.
sentence.textCn: 她说她的未婚夫不会再让她拍电影。

sentence.text: Then she introduced us to Carlos and told us they would get married next week.'
sentence.textCn: 然后她把我们介绍给卡洛斯，并告诉我们他们下星期结婚。”

sentence.text: That's sensational news, isn't it, Kate?
sentence.textCn: 这真是条轰动的消息，是不是？

sentence.text: It certainly is.
sentence.textCn: 当然啦。

sentence.text: He'll be her sixth husband!
sentence.textCn: 他将是她的第6个丈夫！

sentence.text: Are you doing the football pools, Brian?
sentence.textCn: 你正在下足球赛的赌注吗？

sentence.text: Yes, I've nearly finished, Julie.
sentence.textCn: 是的。我就做完了，朱莉。

sentence.text: I'm sure we'll win something this week.
sentence.textCn: 我敢肯定这星期我们会赢一点的。

sentence.text: You always say that, but we never win anything!
sentence.textCn: 你老是那样说，但是我们从来没赢过！

sentence.text: What will you do if you win a lot of money?
sentence.textCn: 要是你赢了许多钱，你打算做什么呢？

sentence.text: If I win a lot of money I'll buy you a mink coat.
sentence.textCn: 要是我赢了许多钱，我给你买件貂皮大衣。

sentence.text: I don't want a mink coat!
sentence.textCn: 我不要貂皮大衣。

sentence.text: I want to see the world.
sentence.textCn: 我要去见见世面。

sentence.text: All right.
sentence.textCn: 好吧。

sentence.text: If we win a lot of money we'll travel round the world and we'll stay at the best hotels.
sentence.textCn: 要是我们赢了很多钱，我们就去周游世界，并且住最好的旅馆。

sentence.text: Then we'll return home and buy a big house in the country.
sentence.textCn: 然后我们返回家园，在乡下买幢大房子。

sentence.text: We'll have a beautiful garden and . . .
sentence.textCn: 我们将有一个漂亮的花园和……

sentence.text: But if we spend all that money we'll be poor again.
sentence.textCn: 但是如果我们把所有钱都花光了，我们又会变穷的。

sentence.text: What'll we do then?
sentence.textCn: 那时我们怎么办呢？

sentence.text: If we spend all the money we'll try and win the football pools again.
sentence.textCn: 如果我们花光了所有钱，我们设法在足球赛赌注上再赢一次。

sentence.text: It's a pleasant dream but everything depends on 'if'!
sentence.textCn: 这是个美好的梦，但一切都取决于“如果”！

sentence.text: Is that you, John?
sentence.textCn: 是你吗，约翰？

sentence.text: Yes, speaking.
sentence.textCn: 是我，请讲。

sentence.text: Tell Mary we'll be late for dinner this evening.
sentence.textCn: 你告诉玛丽，今晚吃饭我们将晚到一会儿。

sentence.text: I'm afraid I don't understand.
sentence.textCn: 恐怕我还不明白您的意思。

sentence.text: Hasn't Mary told you?
sentence.textCn: 玛丽没有告诉你吗？

sentence.text: She invited Charlotte and me to dinner this evening.
sentence.textCn: 她邀请我和夏洛特今晚去吃饭。

sentence.text: I said I would be at your house at six o'clock, but the boss wants me to do some extra work.
sentence.textCn: 我说过我6点到你家，但老板要我加班。

sentence.text: I'll have to stay at the office. I don't know when I'll finish.
sentence.textCn: 我得不得留在办公室，不知道什么时候才能结束。

sentence.text: Oh, and by the way, my wife wants to know if Mary needs any help.
sentence.textCn: 哦，顺便问一句，我妻子想知道玛丽是否需要帮忙。

sentence.text: I don't know what you're talking about.
sentence.textCn: 我不知道您在说些什么。

sentence.text: That is John Smith, isn't it?
sentence.textCn: 你是约翰·史密斯，对吗？

sentence.text: Yes, I'm John Smith.
sentence.textCn: 是的，我是约翰·史密斯。

sentence.text: You are John Smith, the engineer, aren't you?
sentence.textCn: 你是工程师约翰·史密斯，对吗？

sentence.text: That's right.
sentence.textCn: 对。

sentence.text: You work for the Overseas Engineering Company, don't you?
sentence.textCn: 你在海外工程公司上班，是吗？

sentence.text: No, I don't.
sentence.textCn: 不，不是。

sentence.text: I'm John Smith the telephone engineer and I'm repairing your telephone line.
sentence.textCn: 我是电话工程师约翰·史密斯，我正在修理您的电话线。

lesson.title: Sally's first train ride
lesson.titleCn: 萨莉第一次乘火车旅行

sentence.text: Last week, my four-year-old daughter, Sally, was invited to a children's party.
sentence.textCn: 上周，我4岁的女儿萨莉被邀请去参加一个儿童聚会。

sentence.text: I decided to take her by train.
sentence.textCn: 我决定带她乘火车去。

sentence.text: Sally was very excited because she had never travelled on a train before.
sentence.textCn: 萨莉非常激动，因为她从未乘过火车。

sentence.text: She sat near the window and asked questions about everything she saw.
sentence.textCn: 她靠车窗坐着，对她所看到的一切都要问个明白。

sentence.text: Suddenly, a middle-aged lady got on the train and sat opposite Sally.
sentence.textCn: 突然，一个中年妇女上了火车；坐在萨莉的对面。

sentence.text: 'Hello, little girl,' she said.
sentence.textCn: “你好，小姑娘，”她说。

sentence.text: Sally did not answer, but looked at her curiously.
sentence.textCn: 萨莉没回答，却好奇地看着她。

sentence.text: The lady was dressed in a blue coat and a large, funny hat.
sentence.textCn: 那位妇女穿着一件蓝色的大衣，戴着一顶大而滑稽的帽子。

sentence.text: After the train had left the station, the lady opened her handbag and took out her powder compact.
sentence.textCn: 火车开出车站后，那位妇女打开了手提包，拿出了粉盒。

sentence.text: She then began to make up her face.
sentence.textCn: 然后她开始打扮起来。

sentence.text: 'Why are you doing that?' Sally asked.
sentence.textCn: “你为什么要那样做呢？”萨莉问。

sentence.text: 'To make myself beautiful,' the lady answered.
sentence.textCn: “为了把自己打扮漂亮啊，”那位妇女答道。

sentence.text: She put away her compact and smiled kindly.
sentence.textCn: 她放好了粉盒，慈祥地微笑着。

sentence.text: 'But you are still ugly,' Sally said.
sentence.textCn: “可是你仍然难看呀，”萨莉说。

sentence.text: Sally was amused, but I was very embarrassed!
sentence.textCn: 萨莉感到很有趣，而我却很尴尬。
